revised_title: Comparative Analysis of Malagasy Lemuroid Brains
tldr: The author examines the brains of two sub-fossil Malagasy lemuroids, Globilemur Flacourti and Megaladapis madagascariensis, and compares their brain structures with those of living lemurs and other primates. The study reveals significant differences in brain size, shape, and convolutions, suggesting that these extinct lemuroids had distinct neurological features and may have undergone unique evolutionary adaptations.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolution and Comparative Anatomy
